meanings.sent1: The farmer shoveled the muck out of the barn.
meanings.sent2: Please clean up the muck on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The children played in the muck and got all messy.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were covered in a thick layer of muck after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The muck in the pond smelled awful and attracted flies.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to muck up your clothes while painting.
meanings.sent2: The dog loves to muck around in the garden.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mucked up the clean kitchen floor with muddy shoes.
meanings.sent4: The rain will muck the freshly washed car.
meanings.sent5: Try not to muck your hands while working in the garden.

meanings.definition: A state of chaos or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The office was in muck after the files got mixed up.
meanings.sent2: The muck in the classroom made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party turned into a muck of kids running around.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a muck of thoughts and worries.
meanings.sent5: The project ended up in a muck of misunderstandings and delays.
